item.title: Using pyreverse to generate UML class diagrams
item.description: Recently I wanted to generate UML (Unified Modeling Language) diagrams of the structure of an existing codebase for the purpose of having an architecture discussion. I was wondering if there was a tool to generate UML diagrams in Python to save me some manual work. Enter pyreverse: it comes installed with pylint which is a very common development dependency in Python. pyreverse enables you to point to the code you want UML diagrams of, here in my example I was generating a diagram of a project called securedrop-export:

item.title: Debugging programs with pdb
item.description: I recently decided to try my hand at making YouTube videos. I’m planning on mostly making videos about topics I commonly find myself explaining to people, so here’s the first, on using pdb, the built-in debugger in the Python standard library.
